Dear Ms. Reid:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (248) 975-5053.

ALLEGATION:
Youth D’s email account was open on Staff 1’s personal device. Staff 1 saw the
youth had emailed nude selfies to someone. Staff 1 is concerned Youth D is
being groomed by human traffickers.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed Staff 1 by phone on 4/20/21. During the interview she was at the Redford
Police Station in the process of reporting her concerns to the authorities. Staff 1 said
she discovered Youth D, age 15, had emailed nude selfies to someone after borrowing
her phone to sign-in to his email account. Staff 1 saw the emails and pictures because
he mistakenly left his email account open on her phone. What she viewed led her to
suspect the youth is being groomed by human traffickers. Staff 1 reported her concern
2

first to the child protection agency, then to the Redford Police in person and finally to the
Methodist’s Chief Administrator.
Chief Administrator 1 (CA1) contacted me after business hours on 4/20/21, stating Staff
1 had finally shared the above information with her. While Staff 1 acted correctly by
reporting her concerns directly to authorities, CA 1 confirmed that allowing Youth D to
borrow her phone violated Methodist’s staff behavior policy. CA 1 will alert Youth’s D’s
treatment team to incorporate sex education into his treatment plan in order to protect
him from human traffickers.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, and discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: Staff 1 did not follow the agency’s policy that prohibits staff from
allowing youth to use their personal electronic devices.
Otherwise, upon discovering Youth D’s email and photos, Staff
1 acted appropriately by reporting her concerns about possible
human trafficking to the police.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Once an acceptable corrective action plan is received, I recommend this facility
continue its current licensing status.
